body: This is low-hanging fruit if someone wants to take this. Simple bridging of built-in functions. (Please discuss API design here if you take it, it's easier to do here than in a PR code review.)

@technololigy I'm working on this in https://github.com/loadimpact/k6/tree/feature%2Fcrypto. Need it for some examples. Aiming for simple API first. Will then look at maybe mimicking parts of the more flexible nodejs Crypto API: https://nodejs.org/api/crypto.html.
What if you tried implementing it against `feature/js2` instead? Some stuff (metrics emission) is still missing, but something like this would work no problem.
@technololigy Great, I'll have a look at the `feature/js2` branch. Part of the reason for doing this work is because I want to get an oauth1 example created so I want to be able to run tests.

Note to all: @robingustafsson has said it is fine to make a bounty out of this issue, so I'm putting one up. If someone starts working on it, they can look at Robin's feature branch (mentioned above) for inspiration, but he started writing this for the old js runner and we want it implemented for the js2 runner. This runner is included in the master branch, but disabled by default (you have to supply a --type js2 switch when running k6 to make it use the js2 runner).
Update: the old JS runner is gone, JS2 is all that remains. The code in the feature branch won't work anymore though.
As a workaround, importing a JS library could make the job.
Just submitted PR #208 for this. It's a fairly basic wrapper that follows the proposed API.
